results.name: RX-78-1 Prototype Gundam
results.header: The RX-78-1 Prototype Gundam is a mobile suit introduced in the original design series Mobile Suit Variation. It is the predecessor of the RX-78-2 Gundam.

results.name: FA-78%EF%BC%BBG%EF%BC%BD Full Armor Gundam Ground Type
results.header: The FA-78[G] Full Armor Gundam Ground Type is a mobile suit introduced in MSV-R.

results.name: RX-78(G)E Gundam EX
results.header: “ It's like a shadow you can't shake off. ” —Iria Solari describes what Gundam EX is like to Maj. Gen. Yuri Kellerne.[1] The RX-78(G)E Gundam EX (ガンダムEX, Gandamu EX?) was an Earth Federation mobile suit introduced in the ONA Mobile Suit Gundam: Requiem for Vengeance.[2]

results.name: RX-78-2 Gundam
results.header: “ Damn! That Federation mobile suit is a monster! ” —Char Aznable The RX-78-2 Gundam (RX-78-2 ガンダム, Āru Ekkusu Nanajū Hachi no Ni Gandamu?) is the titular mobile suit of the anime Mobile Suit Gundam. Part of the RX-78 Gundam series, it was primarily piloted by Amuro Ray.
results.pilots: Amuro Ray, MSG, Sayla Mass, MSG, Ryu Jose, MSG II SoS, Shiro Kyoda, Takeshi Iori, Hal Vizardt, Tristan, Hiroto Kuga, Mercury Promenade, Tokio Kurono, Aiko Anna Pruna

results.name: Half Gundam
results.header: The Half Gundam is a prototype general purpose mobile suit that appears in the one-shot manga Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam 1/2 UC 0087: Another Story. The unit is piloted by Kan Woo.

results.name: PF-78-1 Perfect Gundam
results.header: The PF-78-1 Perfect Gundam is a Gunpla based on RX-78-2 Gundam and introduced in the manga Plamo-Kyoshiro, where it is built and piloted by Shiro Kyoda. It later became a mobile suit as part of the original design series Mobile Suit Variations (MSV). It was designed by Kunio Okawara, and later redesigned by Hajime Katoki for Gundam Fix Figuration.

results.name: RX-78-3 G-3 Gundam
results.header: The RX-78-3 G-3 Gundam is a variation of RX-78-2 Gundam introduced in the novelization of Mobile Suit Gundam.

results.name: RX-78-4 Gundam Unit 4 %22G04%22
results.header: The RX-78-4 Gundam Unit 4 (aka "G04") is a mobile suit introduced in the M-MSV original design series. Its design was updated for the video game Mobile Suit Gundam: Encounters in Space and the manga Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: Space, To the End of a Flash.

results.name: RX-78-5 Gundam Unit 5 %22G05%22
results.header: The RX-78-5 Gundam Unit 5 (aka "G05") is a mobile suit introduced in the M-MSV original design series. Its design was updated for the video game Mobile Suit Gundam: Encounters in Space as well as the manga Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: Space, To the End of a Flash.

results.name: RX-78-6 Gundam Unit 6
results.header: The RX-78-6 Gundam Unit 6, (also known as Gundam "Mudrock" or Gundam G06), is a mobile suit from Kunio Okawara's M-MSV original design series. Its design was updated for Mobile Suit Gundam: Zeonic Front by Keiichiro Katagiri.

results.name: RX-78-7 7th Gundam
results.header: The RX-78-7 7th Gundam (aka RX-78-7 Gundam) was intended to be the seventh mobile suit in the RX-78 Gundam series, belonging to the Second Lot of Project V models. It first appeared as a part of Kunio Okawara's M-MSV. It was redesigned and featured in Mobile Suit Gundam: Battlefield Record U.C. 0081.

results.name: FA-78-3 Full Armor 7th Gundam
results.header: The FA-78-3 Full Armor 7th Gundam is a mobile suit introduced in M-MSV. It was later redesigned and appears in the video game Mobile Suit Gundam: Battlefield Record U.C. 0081.

results.name: HFA-78-3 Heavy Full Armor 7th Gundam
results.header: The HFA-78-3 Heavy Full Armor 7th Gundam (also FHA-78-3 Heavy Full Armor 7th Gundam) An upgraded armor unit for FA-78-3 Full Armor 7th Gundam, that first appeared as a part of Kunio Okawara's Missing Mobile Suit Variations (M-MSV). Its design were updated for Mobile Suit Gundam: Battlefield Record U.C. 0081 video game, by Hajime Katoki.

results.name: RX-78/C.A. Casval%27s Gundam
results.header: The RX-78/C.A. Casval's Gundam is a mobile suit introduced in the video game Gihren's Greed.

results.name: PF-78-3 Perfect Gundam III
results.header: The PF-78-3 Perfect Gundam III "Red Warrior" is a plastic model that appeared in the manga Plamo-Kyoshiro. It was designed by Kunio Okawara and later by Hajime Katoki for the Gundam Fix Figuration version.

results.name: FA-78-1 Full Armor Gundam
results.header: The FA-78-1 Full Armor Gundam, also known as Gundam Full Armor Type or Full Armor Gundam (Type A), was a variant of the RX-78-2 Gundam introduced in the original design series Mobile Suit Variation.
results.pilots: Heinz Baer, Takashi Kitamoto, Fritz, Amuro Ray

results.name: FA-78-2 Heavy Gundam
results.header: The FA-78-2 Heavy Gundam is a mobile suit introduced in the MS-X series.

results.name: RX-78SP Gunner Gundam
results.header: The RX-78-SP Gunner Gundam is a variant of the RX-78-2 Gundam that first appeared in MSV-R.

results.name: FA-78 Full Armor Gundam (Thunderbolt Ver.)
results.header: Notes: Citations required The FA-78 Full Armor Gundam (Thunderbolt Ver.) is a mobile suit that appears in the manga Mobile Suit Gundam Thunderbolt and its animated adaptation. It is piloted by Io Fleming.

results.name: Perfect Gundam (Thunderbolt Ver.)
results.header: The Perfect Gundam is a custom mobile suit from the Mobile Suit Gundam Thunderbolt manga. It is piloted by Daryl Lorenz.

results.name: RX-78XX Gundam Pixy
results.header: The RX-78XX Gundam Pixy (ガンダムピクシー) is a prototype close-quarters combat mobile suit introduced in the video game Mobile Suit Gundam: Cross Dimension 0079. known pilots included Bork Cry and Fred Reber.
results.pilots: Bork Cry, Fred Reber, Doug Schneid, Doris Brand, Cortés, Lilith Aiden

results.name: RX-79%EF%BC%BBG%EF%BC%BD Gundam Ground Type
results.header: “ This handles nothing like a GM at all! So this is what a Gundam's like... ” —Terry Sanders Jr. The RX-79[G] Gundam Ground Type is a limited production mobile suit introduced in the Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team OVA.
results.pilots: Shiro Amada, Terry Sanders Jr., Karen Joshua, Matt Healy, Kamuna Tachibana, Barry Balzary, Nao Jessica Parker, Sebastian Kurie, Michel Ninorich, Aina Sahalin, Itsuse Hiko Turner, Damon Keisley, Naomi Kudo

results.name: RX-79%EF%BC%BBG%EF%BC%BDEz-8 Gundam Ez8
results.header: The RX-79[G]Ez-8 Gundam Ez8 is a customized RX-79[G] Gundam Ground Type introduced in the OVA Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team and is piloted by Shiro Amada.

results.name: RX-79Ez-8/HAC Gundam Ez8 Heavy Armed Custom
results.header: The RX-79Ez-8/HAC Gundam Ez8 Heavy Armed Custom (Gundam Ez8 HAC for short) is a variant of RX-79Ez-8 Gundam Ez-8 Kai. It was introduced in the game SD Gundam G Generation Gather Beat.

results.name: RX-79Ez-8/HMC Gundam Ez8 High Mobility Custom
results.header: The RX-79Ez-8/HMC Gundam Ez8 High Mobility Custom, often called Gundam Ez8 HMC for short, is a variant of the RX-79Ez-8 Gundam Ez-8 Kai. It was introduced in the game SD Gundam G Generation Gather Beat.

results.name: RX-79%EF%BC%BBG%EF%BC%BDF Slyfrail
results.header: The RX-79[G]F Slyfrail is a customized RX-79［G］ Gundam Ground Type introduced in the video game Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. ENGAGE.

results.name: RX-79%EF%BC%BBG%EF%BC%BDSW Slave Wraith
results.header: The RX-79[G]SW Slave Wraith is a mobile suit introduced in the video game Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: Missing Link.

results.name: RX-79BD-1 Blue Destiny Unit 1
results.header: The RX-79BD-1 Blue Destiny Unit 1 is a variant of the RX-79[G] Gundam Ground Type introduced in Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny and was piloted by Yuu Kajima.

results.name: RX-79BD-2 Blue Destiny Unit 2
results.header: Notes: Citations required The RX-79BD-2 Blue Destiny Unit 2 is a variant of the RX-79［G］ Gundam Ground Type introduced in the game Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny. It belonged to the Earth Federation Forces before it was stolen by the Principality of Zeon and piloted by Nimbus Schterzen.

results.name: RX-79BD-3 Blue Destiny Unit 3
results.header: The RX-79BD-3 Blue Destiny Unit 3 is a variant of the RX-79(G) Gundam Ground Type introduced in the game Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny, and was primarily piloted by Yuu Kajima.

results.name: RX-78EX-PH-1 Zephyr Gundam
results.header: The RX-78EX-PH-1 Zephyr Gundam "Zephyr Phantom" appeared in the manga Outer Gundam and was designed by Masafumi Matsuura.

results.name: RXX G-Dummy
results.header: The RXX G-Dummy is a mobile suit featured in PILLOW TALK GUNDAM NIGHT=HAWKS!.

results.name: RX-78NT-1 Gundam NT-1
results.header: The RX-78NT-1 Gundam NT-1, nicknamed Alex, was a Newtype-use mobile suit created by the Earth Federation Forces. It was introduced in the OVA Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket.

results.name: FA-78NT-1 Full Armor Alex
results.header: The FA-78NT-1 Full Armor Alex (aka FA-78NT-1 Full Armor Gundam NT-1) was a variant of the RX-78NT-1 Gundam NT-1 introduced in Mobile Suit Gundam 0080 MSV. It later appeared in Mobile Suit Gundam Katana.

results.name: MRX-002 Newtype Use Prototype Gundam
results.header: The MRX-002 Newtype Use Prototype Gundam is a prototype mobile suit from the MSV90 design series featured in the Comic BonBon March 1990 issue. It was illustrated by Tatsuya Tomosugi.

results.name: RX-78NT-X NT-X
results.header: The RX-78NT-X (MRX-003) NT-X (pronounced Netix) is a Mobile Suit which was featured in the video game SD Gundam G Generation Series.

results.name: RX-78AN-01 Gundam AN-01 %22Tristan%22
results.header: The RX-78AN-01 Gundam AN-01 "Tristan" is a mobile suit from the Mobile Suit Gundam Twilight Axis light novel, its ONA adaptation, as well as the manga adaptation.

results.name: RX-78AN-01FA Gundam Tristan %E3%80%88Failnaught%E3%80%89
results.header: The RX-78AN-01FA Gundam Tristan〈Failnaught〉 is a mobile suit from the Mobile Suit Gundam Twilight Axis (Manga). A full armor form of the RX-78AN-01 Gundam AN-01 "Tristan", it appears in place of the RX-78KU-01 Kurwenal in the manga.

results.name: RX-78AL Atlas Gundam
results.header: The RX-78AL Atlas Gundam is a prototype mobile suit that appears in the manga Mobile Suit Gundam Thunderbolt and its animated adaptation. It is piloted by Io Flemming.

results.name: RX-78GP00 Gundam %22Blossom%22
results.header: The RX-78GP00 Gundam "Blossom" was a mobile suit introduced in the Dengeki Hobby Magazine project Mobile Suit Gundam Secret Weapons Phantom Bullets.

results.name: RX-78GP01 Gundam %22Zephyranthes%22
results.header: The RX-78GP01 Gundam "Zephyranthes" (aka Zephyranthes, GP01, Unit 1) is a prototype general-purpose mobile suit introduced in the Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory OVA. It was piloted by Kou Uraki.

results.name: RX-78GP01Fa Full Armor Zephyranthes
results.header: The RX-78GP01Fa Full Armor Zephyranthes is a variant of the RX-78GP01 Gundam "Zephyranthes" introduced in the "Master Archive Mobile Suit RX-78GP01 Gundam Zephyranthes" Book.

results.name: RX-78GP01-Fb Gundam %22Zephyranthes%22 Full Burnern
results.header: The RX-78GP01-Fb Gundam "Zephyranthes" Full Burnern is the upgraded space-use version of the RX-78GP01 Gundam "Zephyranthes" introduced in the OVA Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory. it is piloted by Kou Uraki.

results.name: RX-78GP02A Gundam %22Physalis%22
results.header: “ "Magnificent. It's a superb mobile suit.""I think so, too, sir." ” —Anavel Gato and Kou Uraki, while the former was disguised as a Federation officer The RX-78GP02A Gundam "Physalis" (RX-78GP02A ガンダム試作2号機 "サイサリス", Gandamu Shisaku Nigōki "Saisarisu"?), also known as Gundam Unit 2 (ガンダム2号機, Gandamu Nigōki?) and GP02A, is the second of four mobile suits in the Gundam Development Project featured in OVA Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory. Originally belonging to Earth Federation, it was stolen and piloted by Delaz Fleet's ace pilot, Anavel Gato.
results.pilots: Anavel Gato, Quattro Bajeena, MSG-Z Define, Kanesada Tsurugi, Largo Ford

results.name: RX-78GP02A Gundam GP02A (Type-MLRS)
results.header: RX-78GP02A Gundam GP02A (Type-MLRS) is a variant of the RX-78GP02A Gundam "Physalis" introduced in the original design series Harmony of Gundam by Hajime Katoki.

results.name: RX-78GP03S Gundam %22Stamen%22
results.header: The RX-78GP03S Gundam "Stamen" (Development codename: Dendrobium Stamen) is a mobile suit that serves as the core unit for the RX-78GP03 Gundam "Dendrobium". It was introduced in Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory OVA and was piloted by Kou Uraki.
results.pilots: Defrah Kar, Kou Uraki, Bernard Monsha

results.name: RX-78GP03 Gundam %22Dendrobium%22
results.header: “ They call this thing a mobile suit? ” —Mora Boscht The RX-78GP03 (RX-78GP03D) Gundam "Dendrobium" (aka Dendrobium, GP03) is the third unit of the Gundam Development Project, and the combination of the mobile suit unit - the RX-78GP03S Gundam "Stamen" - and the armed base "Orchis". It was introduced in the OVA series Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory and also featured in Episode 4 of Gundam Evolve. It was initially piloted by Anaheim test pilot Defrah Kar, and later by Federation MS pilot Kou Uraki.
results.pilots: Defrah Kar, Kou Uraki, Kelley Layzner

results.name: RX-78GP04G Gundam %22Gerbera%22
results.header: The RX-78GP04G Gundam "Gerbera" is a prototype general purpose mobile suit (assault type) and the fifth of five mobile suits in the Gundam Development Project, appearing in Mobile Suit Gundam: Encounters in Space and Mobile Suit Gundam: Gihren's Greed. It was eventually developed into the AGX-04 Gerbera Tetra.
results.pilots: Leos Alloy, Clara Lodge, Peche Montagne

results.name: RX-121 Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel] is a Mobile Suit featured in the photo-novel and manga Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-121-1 Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel Custom%EF%BC%BD Icarus Unit
results.header: The RX-121-1 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Custom] Icarus Unit is a prototype high mobility variant of the RX-121-1 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Custom] . It is featured in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans series.

results.name: RX-121-1 Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel Custom%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Custom] is the upgraded form of the RX-121 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel]  from the Universal Century timeline. It was featured in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans. The unit is piloted by Wes Murphy.
results.pilots: Wes Murphy, Eliard Hunter, Audrey April

results.name: RX-121-1%2BFF-X29A Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel-Rah%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121-1+FF-X29A Gundam TR-1 [Hazel-Rah] is the combined version of the RX-121-1 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Custom]​ with the FF-X29A G-Parts [Hrududu]​. It appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans manga.

results.name: RX-121-1%2BFF-X29A Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel-Rah%EF%BC%BD Second Form
results.header: The RX-121-1+FF-X29A Gundam TR-1 [Hazel-Rah] Second Form is a mobile suit appearing in the manga Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-121-2 Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121-2 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel II] is a mobile Suit from the Gundam Universal Century timeline. It is a variant of the RX-121 Gundam TR-1 ［Hazel］ featured in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans manga. The unit is piloted by Eliard Hunter.

results.name: RX-121-2A Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBAdvanced Hazel%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121-2A Gundam TR-1 [Advanced Hazel] is a mobile Suit that appears in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.
results.pilots: Eliard Hunter, Audrey April, Carl Matsubara

results.name: RX-121-2P Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel Owsla%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121-2P Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Owsla] is a Mobile Suit that appears in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-121-2P Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHazel Owsla%EF%BC%BD Gigantic Arm Unit
results.header: The RX-121-2P Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Owsla] Gigantic Arm Unit is a variant of the RX-121-2 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Owsla] equipped with the arms of the MRX-009 Psycho Gundam. It appears in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-121-2 Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBFiver II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121-2 Gundam TR-1 [Fiver II] is the final variant of the RX-121-2 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Owsla]​. It is featured in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-121-3C Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHaze%27n-thley%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121-3C Gundam TR-1 [Haze'n-thley] is a Mobile Suit appearing in the settings material of Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-121-3C Gundam TR-1 %EF%BC%BBHaze%27n-thley-Rah II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-121-3C Gundam TR-1 [Haze'n-thley-Rah II] is a mobile suit that appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans series.

results.name: RX-123 Gundam TR-S%EF%BC%BBEl-Ahrairah%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-123 Gundam TR-S [El-Ahrairah] is a mobile armor appearing in Advance of Zeta Re-Boot: Gundam Inle. The RX-123 Gundam TR-S［Hazel Hrair］ serves as the main body that is equipped with specialized reinforcement parts.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBWoundwort%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Woundwort] is the last TR series mobile suit produced by the Titans Test Team. The unit appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans manga.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBHaze%27n-thley II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Haze'n-thley II] (also known as the RX-124HS Gundam TR-6 [Advanced Woundwort] Haze'n-thley II Form) is an experimental mobile suit that appears in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans and Advance of Zeta Re-Boot: Gundam Inle.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBHaze%27n-thley II-Rah%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Haze'n-thley II-Rah] (also known as the Gundam TR-6 [Advanced Woundwort Ex]) is a transformable mobile suit that appears in the novel Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBDandelion II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Dandelion II] appears in the photo novel Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans. The Dandelion II is named after the character Dandelion (fictional rabbit character from Watership Down).

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBFiver II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Fiver II] is a mobile weapon that appears in the photo novel Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBInle%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Inle] is a variable mobile armor featured in the photo novel Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans. The Inle is a combination of multiple TR-6 forms, the Dandelion II form and the Fiver II form of the RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Woundwort].

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBPsyco Inle%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Psyco Inle] is a concept mobile armor from Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBHrairoo II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Hrairoo II] is a mobile suit that appears in the novel Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBKehaar II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Kehaar II] is a mobile suit that appears in the photo novel Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBAdvanced Kehaar II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Advanced Kehaar II] is a variant of the RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Kehaar II]​ produced by the Titans Test Team. The unit appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans novel.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBWoundwort-Rah%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Woundwort-Rah] is a variant of the TR-6 [Woundwort] series produced by the Titans Test Team. The unit appears in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBWoundwort%EF%BC%BD Gigantic Mode
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Woundwort] Gigantic Mode, also known as the RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Woundwort] Psycho Gundam Mk-II Gigantic Arm Unit, is a variant of the Gundam TR-6 Woundwort produced by the Titans Test Team. The unit appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans novel.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBHi-Zack II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Hi-Zack II] is a variant of the TR-6 [Woundwort] series produced by The Titan Test Team. The unit appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans manga.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBHazel II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Hazel II] is a variant of the TR-6 [Woundwort] series produced by the Titans Test Team. The unit appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans novel.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBGaplant II%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Gaplant II] is a variant of the TR-6 [Woundwort] series produced by the Titans Test Team. It appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans novel.

results.name: RX-124 Gundam TR-6 %EF%BC%BBQueenly%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Queenly] (also known as the Gundam TR-6 [Woundwort] Base Defense Form) is a mobile suit variant of the RX-124 Gundam TR-6 [Woundwort] that appears in Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans.

results.name: ARZ-125 Re-Haze
results.header: The ARZ-125 Re-Haze (aka Re-Hyze) is a transformable mobile suit from Advance of Zeta Re-Boot: Gundam Inle . It is piloted by Alicia Zabi.

results.name: MSW-004 Gundam %EF%BC%BBKestrel%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The MSW-004 Gundam [Kestrel] is a mobile suit that appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Traitor to Destiny series of light novels. It is piloted by Van Asiliaino.

results.name: MSW-004 Gundam (Kestrel) Maneuver Exterior
results.header: The MSW-004 Gundam [Kestrel] Maneuver Exterior is a variant of the MSW-004 Gundam [Kestrel]. It appears in the Advance of Zeta: The Traitor to Destiny series of light novels. It is piloted by Van Asiliaino.

results.name: MSW-004 Gundam (Kestrel) Armor Exterior
results.header: The MSW-004 Gundam [Kestrel] Armor Exterior is a variant of the MSW-004 Gundam [Kestrel] from the Advance of Zeta: The Traitor to Destiny series of light novels. It is piloted by Van Asiliaino.

results.name: MSW-004 Full-Armor Kestrel
results.header: The MSW-004 Gundam Full Armor [Kestrel] is a variant of the MSW-004 Gundam [Kestrel] from the Advance of Zeta: The Traitor to Destiny series of light novels. It is piloted by Van Asiliaino.

results.name: MSS-008 Le Cygne
results.header: MSS-008 Le Cygne (pronounced "Luh Seen", French for "The Swan") is a prototype mobile suit fundamentally designed for Newtype pilot Asuna Elmarit. It is featured in the manga series Mobile Suit Gundam École du Ciel.

results.name: ORX-008 Gundam %EF%BC%BBGullinbursti%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The ORX-008 Gundam ［Gullinbursti］ is a mobile suit from the Advance of Zeta: The Traitor to Destiny light novel series. Its pilot is Yohn Juliana.

results.name: ORX-009 Gundam %EF%BC%BBSk%C3%B6ll%EF%BC%BD
results.header: The ORX-009 Gundam ［Sköll］ is a mobile suit from the Advance of Zeta The Traitor to Destiny: Blue Wings of the AEUG light novel series. It is piloted by Ernest McGuire.

results.name: RX-78MS00Z %22Engage Zero%22
results.header: The RX-78MS00Z "Engage Zero" (エンゲージゼロ, Engēji Zero?), also called the Gundam Development Test Unit 0 (Engage Zero) (ガンダム開発試験0番機（エンゲージゼロ）, Gundam Development Test Unit 0 (Engage Zero)?) is a mobile suit first introduced in the smartphone game Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. ENGAGE. It was also formerly referred to as the RX-78 MS00Z Gundam GP00 (Engage Zero), but this usage was phased out to better differentiate it from the RX-78GP00 Gundam Prototype Unit 0.

results.name: RX-78MS00Z-B Engage Zero Additional Booster Equipment Type
results.header: The RX-78MS00Z-B Engage Zero Additional Booster Equipment Type (エンゲージゼロ・追加ブースター装備型, Engēji Zero Tsuika Būsutā Sōbi-gata?) is a mobile suit first introduced in the smartphone game Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. ENGAGE.

results.name: ORX-00Z Engage Zero Psycommu Test Type
results.header: The ORX-00Z Engage Zero Psycommu Test Type (エンゲージゼロ・サイコミュ試験型, Engēji Zero Saikomyu Shiken-gata?) is a mobile suit first introduced in the smartphone game Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. ENGAGE.

results.header: The ORX-00Z-2 Engage Zero INCOM-equipped Type (エンゲージゼロ・インコム搭載型, Engēji Zero Inkomu Tōsai-gata?) is a mobile suit first introduced in the smartphone game Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. ENGAGE.

results.header: The AMX-00Z Engage Zero Yonghwavin (エンゲージゼロ・ヨンファヴィン, Engēji Zero Yonfavu~in?) is a mobile suit first introduced in the smartphone game Mobile Suit Gundam U.C. ENGAGE.
